cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida

motion.direction: W (drifting, forecast to turn N then NNE)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to accelerate north-northeast, cross the Florida Big Bend Thursday, then move across southeast Georgia and emerge off the Georgia–South Carolina coast Friday, continuing northeastward just offshore the U.S. East Coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Indian Pass–Anclote River area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect Anclote River to Indian Pass FL; Tropical-storm Watch west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line FL (Gulf coast only at this time)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft coastal inundation at high tide)
weather_observation.wind: Potential sustained winds 35–45 kt (40–50 mph) with higher gusts as the system passes Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge of 2–4 ft possible along the Georgia coast including the Savannah River entrance at times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts; flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous seas/strong currents in approaches and harbor channel.
